pages.title: Flax
pages.text: Flax is a wild plant, native to temperate plains-like biomes.Destroying the block with shears will give the plant itself, without shears- flax seeds.Flax can be cultivated with these seeds.

pages.title: Dry flax plant
pages.text: When cultivated flax is fully-grown, it can be grabbed to get dry flax.This flax plant can be layed down on a ground.After that beat it with a stick to soften plant fibers and get raw linen fiber.

pages.title: Linen fiber
pages.text: Linen fiber is used to spin linen yarn with a spinning wheel.

pages.title: Linen yarn
pages.text: Linen yarn is a result of spinning raw linen fiber by a spinning wheel.It can be used to make linen cloth (with a loom) and craft strings.

pages.title: Linen cloth
pages.text: Linen cloth is a result of weaving linen yarns.It is used in crafting recipes.
